word_mean: 摄取量：身体摄取并利用的物质量

sentence.Network_en: We are constantly being reminded to cut down our fat intake.
sentence.Network_cn: 不断有人提醒我们要减少脂肪的摄入量。

sentence.Network_en: Nutritionists say only 33% of our calorie intake should be from fat.
sentence.Network_cn: 营养学家说我们所摄入的卡路里中只应有33％来自脂肪。

sentence.Network_en: Add pasta to your salads to bump up your fibre intake.
sentence.Network_cn: 在色拉中加入意大利面条，增加你的纤维摄入量。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally Scots and northern English): from in + take

entry.tran: (食物、饮料、空气等的)摄取量,吸入量
entry.def: Your intake of a particular kind of food, drink, or air is the amount that you eat, drink, or breathe in.

example.ex: Your intake of alcohol should not exceed two units per day...
example.tran: 每天的饮酒量不应超过两个计量单位。

entry.tran: (组织或地方的)新纳入者，新招收者
entry.def: The people who are accepted into an organization or place at a particular time are referred to as a particular intake .

example.ex: ...one of this year's intake of students...
example.tran: 今年新招学生中的一个

example.ex: There was a proposal in the United States to quadruple its annual intake of immigrants.
example.tran: 在美国有提案建议把每年移民的接收数量增加3倍。

entry.tran: (通常因震惊而)倒吸的一口冷气
entry.def: When someone takes an intake of breath, they breathe in quickly and noisily, usually because they are shocked at something.

example.ex: I heard, even over the babble of the crowd, a sharp, shocked intake of breath.
example.tran: 即便人声鼎沸,我还是听到有人猛地倒抽一口冷气。

means.word_mean: 1. the process of taking food into the body through the mouth (as by eating)
2. an opening through which fluid is admitted to a tube or container

auth_sentence.content: Intake of fruits after a meal is strongly suggested.
auth_sentence.res_content: Intake of fruits after a meal is strongly suggested.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Intake of fruits after a meal is strongly suggested.

auth_sentence.content: How does increased caloric intake lead to cognitive impairment?

auth_sentence.content: Two-thirds of his total intake came from junk food.
auth_sentence.res_content: Two-thirds of his total intake came from junk food.

Sentence.sentence: A study by researchers at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF), Stanford University and Columbia University shows that even a modest decrease in daily salt intake (摄入) can lead to dramatic health benefits.
The team conducted a computer-based analysis to determine the impact a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt intake on rates of heart disease and death
The conclusion: by cutting salt intake nationwide, the U.S. could save $10 billion to $24 billion annually in health care costs.

This means that there could be an extra three billion mouths to feed by the end of the century, a period in which substantial changes are anticipated in the wealth, calorie intake and dietary preferences of people in developing countries across the world.

sentences.en: The intake of gasoline was stopped by a clogged fuel line.
sentences.cn: 汽油的注入由于管道阻塞而停止了。

sentences.en: The Tornado jet fighter-bomber has two air intakes.
sentences.cn: 旋风式喷气轰炸机有两个空气入口。

means.word_mean: (一定时期内)进入或纳入的人数

sentences.en: Intake in state primary schools is down by 10%.
sentences.cn: 公立小学入学人数下降了10%。

jushi.english: The air intake must be silenced to some degree.
jushi.chinese: 进气口的噪声太大，必须在一定程度上加以消除。

jushi.english: One chocolate bar like this is equal to a large meal in calorie intake.
jushi.chinese: 从摄入的热量来说,一块这样的巧克力相当于一顿饱餐。

jushi.english: Intake in state primary schools is down by 10%.
jushi.chinese: 公立小学入学人数下降了10%。
